text: Frank Lewis O'Bannon (January 30, 1930 â€“ September 13, 2003) was an American politician. He served as the 47th Governor of Indiana from 1997 until his death in 2003. In 2003, O'Bannon suffered a massive stroke in Chicago, Illinois, while attending a trade conference. He died days later and was succeeded by his Lieutenant Governor Joe E. Kernan. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2003 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Governors of Indiana Category:Politicians from Louisville, Kentucky Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Lieutenant Governors of Indiana Category:Members of the Indiana General Assembly
title: Frank O'Bannon
